lexUnit.name: crane.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stretch out (one's neck) in order to see something.

sentence.text: She knelt in the embrasure , craning to look out .
Sidacai was craning to look over Alexei 's shoulder .
Then shielding her eyes with her arm she craned to peer inside .
She craned to see what the man was dragging , it looked like a body .
Adam craned his neck to look after the others .
He was craning his neck to look up but nothing was visible except the rolling grey mist that had almost reached the jeep .
She looked suspicious and craned her neck to see past me .
Cleo turned and craned her neck to take in the massive black pile rising behind them .
Omally craned his neck above the crowd and peered towards the sinister contrivance .
The barman craned his head across the counter .
The ostrich , anxious to join in the fun again , craned his long neck well forward over the boundary fence .
Most of the young , rather shabbily dressed people in the pub shouted over it or craned their heads closer to hear .
A group of grinning Koreans from Kazakhstan craned their necks skywards as she spun like a top .
People in Donegal listened earnestly to the priest , craning forward as if to show him that they were there , but did not seem to be taking in the words .
The old man stopped in surprise and then craned forward , squinting in the dim light coming through the grimly fanlight .
I draw parallel with the door and crane forward to see into the room .
Helen , never taking her eyes off Alexandra , craned sideways so that she could wind a finger round and round in a hole in her black stocking .
Her embarrassment forgotten , Folly craned across him to see the dome which , until now , she had seen only in pictures .
Kaidu craned past Jehan 's arm to look at Jehana .
` They 've done it , the young swine , " he groaned , craning out of his high window , clutching the cold dewy sill .
She stopped the car and craned out of the window , trying to see over the blackberry thicket that stretched for half a mile along the cliff-top .
Tuppe craned up his head to the mighty hotel .
He craned over the balcony again , but finally he seemed to sigh .
There was a shout on the bridge , and the knot of figures craned over the railing .
The voice from the back of the room caused every head to crane round , although the mild tones of Phil Aldrich were known so well by now to everyone .
